Nå skal jeg også være på Github.

## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document.
To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code.
You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| eval: false
#| echo: true
2 * / 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r}
#| label: fig-cars-plot
#| fig-cap: "Scatterplot of data from the classic *cars* dataset."
#| echo: true
#| out-width: 70%
plot(cars)
```

The plot in @fig-cars-plot shows the association between speed and braking distance.

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| eval: false
library(tidyverse)
lm(da = mtcars, form = 'mpg ~ wt + disp + fct(as.character(cyl), levels = c("4", "6", "8"))') |> 
  summary()
```

```{r}
#| label: tbl-reg-res
#| tbl-cap: "Regression model for `mpg` (miles per gallon) for 32 cars from the *mtcars* dataset."
mtcars  |> 
  mutate(
    cyl = fct(
      x = as.character(cyl), 
      levels = c("4", "6", "8")
      )
  ) %>%
  lm(
    formula = 'mpg ~ wt + disp + cyl', 
    data = .) |> 
  #summary() |> 
  tidy(
    conf.int = TRUE,
    conf.level = 0.95
  ) |> 
  flextable() |> 
  colformat_double(j = 2:7, digits = 3) |> 
  autofit() |> 
  theme_booktabs()
```

As can be seen from @tbl-reg-res the variable \``disp`\` is not signifikant.

A_{m,n} = 
 \begin{pmatrix}

  a_{2,1} & a_{2,2} & \cdots & a_{2,n} \\
  \vdots  & \vdots  & \ddots & \vdots  \\

 \end{pmatrix}
$$
